item.title: When Will Russia Fall? (October Update)
item.description: October’s update tracks compounding fragility in Russia’s war effort—deeper refinery strikes, deteriorating cash flow, pricier logistics, and mounting labor shortages—arguing capacity remains but sustainability erodes.

item.title: Bandcamp: The New Old Way To Experience Music
item.description: An argument for buying music again: why Bandcamp’s album‑first storefront, community liner notes, and direct‑to‑artist economics make discovery slower—but better—and restore the feeling of owning music in a streaming era.

item.title: Abortion Was Never The Issue
item.description: Abortion wasn’t the product; it was the slogan. Traces how Paul Weyrich reframed a coalition born in resistance to civil‑rights enforcement into a unifying moral crusade to preserve a racialized, Christian, patriarchal order.

item.title: A Case Study in Motte-and-Bailey: “Be Reasonable” as a Shield for Extreme Health Claims
item.description: Shows how a “be reasonable” defense of Trump’s Tylenol‑in‑pregnancy warning operates as a motte‑and‑bailey—retreating to truisms to launder an indefensible claim—and clarifies what the evidence actually supports.

item.title: Why Russia Keeps Prodding the West: A Three-Pronged Tactic
item.description: Moscow’s recurring provocations are a three-pronged tactic—shoring the domestic siege narrative, deterring Western aid via escalation fear, and amplifying disinformation—signaling fragility rather than strength.

item.title: Gaza’s Hostage Standoff
item.description: Examines the stalled hostage diplomacy and argues that, while Hamas’s hostage‑taking is criminal, Israel’s control of firepower and Gaza’s aid gates gives it the primary, immediate agency to reduce mass harm now—de‑link aid from hostages and sequence monitored pauses toward releases.

item.title: Wake up! Russia is falling
item.description: Russia is in managed decline—paying more for shrinking gains, rebasing its fleet, straining finances, and inflating NATO risk—and urges planning now for post‑war realities.

item.title: Are there well-founded reasons to believe that Israel is attempting to eradicate the Palestinian population in Gaza?
item.description: Legal‑evidence brief arguing there are credible, documented grounds—spanning UN findings, ICJ orders, major NGOs and Israeli sources—that Israel is committing genocide in Gaza via policies that engineer life‑destroying conditions, and why “speed” doesn’t negate intent.
